1.text: Paul, a prisoner of Jesus Christ, and Timothy our brother, to Philemon our dearly beloved, and fellow-laborer,

2.text: And to our beloved Apphia, and Archippus our fellow-soldier, and to the church in thy house:

3.text: Grace to you, and peace, from God our Father and the Lord Jesus Christ.

4.text: I thank my God, making mention of thee always in my prayers,

5.text: Hearing of thy love and faith, which thou hast towards the Lord Jesus, and towards all saints;

6.text: That the communication of thy faith may become effectual by the acknowledging of every good thing which is in you in Christ Jesus.

7.text: For we have great joy and consolation in thy love, because the bowels of the saints are refreshed by thee, brother.

8.text: Wherefore, though I might be very bold in Christ to enjoin thee that which is convenient.

9.text: Yet for loveâ€™s sake I rather beseech thee, being such one as Paul the aged, and now also a prisoner of Jesus Christ.

10.text: I beseech thee for my son Onesimus, whom I have begotten in my bonds:

11.text: Who in time past was to thee unprofitable, but now profitable to thee and to me:

12.text: Whom I have sent again: thou therefore receive him, that is, my own bowels:

13.text: Whom I would have retained with me, that in thy stead he might have ministered to me in the bonds of the gospel:

14.text: But without thy mind I would do nothing; that thy benefit should not be as it were of necessity, but willingly.

15.text: For perhaps he therefore departed for a season, that thou shouldst receive him for ever;

16.text: Not now as a servant, but above a servant, a brother beloved, specially to me, but how much more to thee, both in the flesh, and in the Lord?

17.text: If thou accountest me therefore a partner, receive him as myself.

18.text: If he hath wronged thee, or oweth thee aught, put that on my account;

19.text: I Paul have written it with my own hand, I will repay it: although I do not say to thee that thou owest to me even thy own self besides.

20.text: Yes, brother, let me have joy of thee in the Lord: refresh my bowels in the Lord.

21.text: Having confidence in thy obedience I wrote to thee, knowing that thou wilt also do more than I say.

22.text: But at the same time prepare me also a lodging; for I trust that through your prayers I shall be given to you.

23.text: There salute thee Epaphras, my fellow-prisoner in Christ Jesus;

24.text: Marcus, Aristarchus, Demas, Lucas, my fellow-laborers.

25.text: The grace of our Lord Jesus Christ be with your spirit. Amen.
